Potato___Early_blight.name: Potato – Early Blight
Potato___Early_blight.cause: Fungal infection (Alternaria solani) usually due to high humidity or water stagnation.
Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric spots on lower leaves, yellowing around lesions.
treatment: Improve soil drainage and avoid overhead watering.
Ensure proper plant spacing for aeration.
prevention: Avoid watering late in the evening.
Mulch the soil to reduce fungal spread.

Potato___Late_blight.name: Potato – Late Blight
Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Large wet lesions on leaves, white fungal growth on underside.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants immediately.
prevention: Do not plant potatoes in same soil consecutively.

Potato___healthy.name: Potato – Healthy
Potato___healthy.symptoms: Normal green leaves with consistent texture.
treatment: Monitor weekly for pests or discoloration.

Tomato___Late_blight.name: Tomato – Late Blight
Tomato___Late_blight.cause: Fungal infection caused by Phytophthora infestans.
Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Brown lesions, white mold on leaf underside.
prevention: Mulch soil to reduce fungal splash.
